short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: A Google Chrome extension that makes it easier to work with Midjourney and Promptalot.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
‚ö†Ô∏è TECHNICAL PROBLEM? ‚ö†Ô∏è
Please contact the developer before leaving a negative review. You are dealing with a real human being here.
‚Äì
I think we can all agree that Discord is a suboptimal place for working with Midjourney. And the endless copying and pasting makes the already cumbersome constraints of the platform only worse. The Promptalot Helper extension aims to eliminate most of these problems and supercharges your prompting experience.

Whether you want to copy an entire prompt or only a specific part of it, or perhaps you want to download an image, Promptalot makes it a breeze and will save you thousands of unnecessary clicks. It also allows you to manage your prompts on the Promptalot platform where you can collect and curate your very best prompts.

So what happens once Midjourney moves to its new web interface? Don't worry, Promptalot will be there to help you solve all of those tiny little inefficiencies which even the most polished web UI is guaranteed to produce. If it's annoying, Promptalot will eventually fix it.

üëã Do you use the Discord Desktop/Mobile App? ‚ùì
This is a browser extension. Emphasis on "browser". So this will only work if you actually use the browser-version of Discord. There is absolutely no way for a Chrome extension to impact anything outside the browser. It's just not possible.

‚ö†Ô∏è Permission Requirements ‚ö†Ô∏è
In order to work and help you get the most out of your prompting experience, the Promptalot Helper extension needs access to pages hosted on discord.com, midjourney.com and promptalot.com. Without these permissions, it is impossible for the extension to attach itself to the UI. No data is collected by the extension. It only helps you do things directly on the page and, if you have a Promptalot account, manage your prompts directly from Midjourney.

üÜï What's New üÜï
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.56, 2024-09-23]: Fixed the toolbar in the Web UI again.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.55, 2024-09-05]: Fixed the toolbar in the Web UI.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.54, 2024-06-23]: Another tiny UI fix on the alpha website.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.53, 2024-06-19]: Small UI Fix. Discord changed its UI code again. Toolbar wouldn't appear.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.52, 2024-06-09]: Fixed issue with splitting image grids on save.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.51, 2024-06-02]: Yet another quick fix because the MJ team to revert half of the UI changes. No comment.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.50, 2024-05-31]: Quick fixes after Midjourney's UI update broken lots of features.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.49, 2024-05-13]: Fixed broken image URLs on various buttons in the toolbar.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.48, 2024-03-29]: Increased stats timer interval to avoid server overload.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.47, 2024-03-28]: Discord toolbar lost all functionality due to changes to Discord's code. This has been fixed. Midjourney stats indicators have also been updated to reflect v6.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.46, 2024-02-15]: Fixed "blocked" scrollbar in Discord. Also resized the sidebar button in Discord. Fixed CSS issues in the Alpha Web UI in Dark Mode. Optimized overall CSS delivery.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.45, 2024-02-08]: Fixed all image-related features due to newly-implemented hotlinking protection by Midjourney/Discord.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.44, 2024-02-07]: Added the "Remove Background" button to the Web UI (settings are still in the Discord, sorry). Various smaller optimizations.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.43, 2024-01-25]: Added small extension popup with "Quick Settings". Allows you to enable or disable the sidebar button (Discord only).
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.42, 2024-01-24]: Mini-update that re-positions and re-colors the image toolbars. Slight adjustments made to the size of the Promptalot sidebar button too.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.41, 2024-01-23]: Full integration of sidebar as well as phase 1 of WebUI integration on Midjourney.com.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.40, 2024-01-19]: Skipped due to bugs.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.39, 2024-01-11]: Fixed bug in new experimental sidebar. Also add support for adding new prompts via the sidebar. Feature is now entering final testing before wider release.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.38, 2024-01-07]: Add "Experimental" feature section for PRO users, including an early version of the new Promptalot sidebar with Discord and Web UI support.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.37, 2023-12-30]: Fixed bug that would occur when trying to add a prompt that contain certain special characters.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.36, 2023-12-20]: Temporary rollback of UI integration due to unforeseen issues with blocked iframe content. I'm investigating and looking for a fix. 
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.35, 2023-12-19]: "Light" integration of Promptalot into MJ Web UI, making Promptalot more easily accessible from within the same tab.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.34, 2023-12-13]: Changed behaviour the "Split Image" feature. It no longer puts the images into a ZIP file. Also compatible with the "Auto-Rename" feature.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.33, 2023-12-10]: Fixed bug in "Delete"-Button that would leave parts of the interface without functionality.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.32, 2023-12-05]: Added ability to deactivate the Auto-Rename feature to avoid conflicts with default download behaviour of the browser.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.31, 2023-12-01]: Added customizable Auto-Rename feature to Download-Button for PRO users. Configurable via the control panel.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.30, 2023-11-07]: Feature Request button now points to internal Promptalot request page for better tracking.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.29, 2023-11-04]: Midjourney.com Support ‚Äì Preparations made for Promptalot Helper compatible with Midjourney's new web UI.
‚Ä¢ [v0.0.28, 2023-10-25]: Bug Fix ‚Äì Discord made changes to its source code. The extension could no longer attach to the UI.
